body.name: Amazon Brand - Mama Bear Hypoallergenic Infant Formula Powder with Iron, Non-GMO, 1.24 Pound (Pack of 1)
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Tomorrow, February 16. Order within 3 hrs 40 mins
features: MANAGE COLIC: Mama Bear Hypoallergenic baby formula, clinically studied for colic due to cow's milk allergy; compare to the nutrition of Nutramigen and Similac Alimentum
BABY'S COMFORT IN MIND: Easy-to-digest proteins help reduce crying and fussiness from colic due to cow's milk allergy; complete nutrition through 12 months
VALUE AND TRUST: An Amazon brand, Mama Bear and all infant formulas sold in the U.S. meet FDA requirements. Compare and save.
DIGESTIVE HEALTH: A probiotic helps support your baby's digestive health; no artificial growth hormones; non-GMO ingredients; gluten free; certified kosher by the Orthodox Union-(U)D
BRAIN SUPPORT: DHA helps support brain development
body.description: Compare to the nutrition of Nutramigen and Similac Alimentum. Mama Bear Hypoallergenic Infant Formula Powder with Iron is clinically studied for cow's milk allergy. Proteins are broken into small pieces to make this hypoallergenic baby formula easier for baby to digest. With a probiotic to help support digestive health. DHA for brain support. Complete nutrition through 12 months. This product differs in appearance and taste compared to milk-based or soy-based formulas. It may separate when chilled. Simply shake well prior to feeding. Non-GMO ingredients: not genetically engineered. No artificial growth hormones: No significant difference has been shown between milk derived from rbST-treated and non-rbST-treated cows. Similac and Alimentum are registered trademarks of Abbott Laboratories. Nutramigen is a registered trademark of Mead Johnson & Co. Mama Bear Hypoallergenic Infant Formula is NOT made by or affiliated with Abbott Laboratories or Mead Johnson & Co. Mama Bear Hypoallergenic Infant Formula does not contain the identical proprietary ingredient blend of prebiotics, patented levels of nucleotides, lutein and lycopene in Similac Alimentum. The product may contain trace levels of genetically engineered material, such as from process sources and manufacturing environments.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Q&A QUESTION: Is Mama Bear an Amazon private-label brand and does Amazon make the products? ANSWER: Yes, Mama Bear Infant Formulas are owned and distributed by Amazon. Amazon works directly with a supplier—a leading infant formula company—to manufacture Mama Bear Infant Formulas. QUESTION: Where are Mama Bear Infant Formulas made? ANSWER: All Mama Bear Infant Formulas are produced in Vermont and Ohio, U.S.A. Our dairy ingredients are sourced from one of the leading dairy markets, including the United States, Canada, and New Zealand. QUESTION: Are infant formulas regulated for quality and safety? ANSWER: Infant formulas are strictly regulated by the FDA to ensure product quality and safety. All infant formulas, by law, must meet or exceed the standards set by the FDA. QUESTION: What nutrients are included in infant formulas and what do they do? ANSWER: All infant formulas sold in the United States must provide complete nutrition for your baby’s first year of life, including protein, carbohydrates, fat, and appropriate vitamins and minerals. Infant formulas are patterned after breast milk. QUESTION: What’s new with Mama Bear infant formula? ANSWER: Mama Bear infant formula now brings a Hypoallergenic options for babies that experience cow’s milk allergy. Our hypoallergenic formula is specifically designed and clinically studied for cow’s milk allergy. It helps calm your baby’s colic symptoms due to cow’s milk allergy. It also is the first and only Mama Bear formula to contain probiotics. This formula, like our other Mama Bear formulas, provides complete nutrition for your baby’s first year of life.

Sensitivity Premium Gentle Complete Comfort Premium Soy Hypoallergenic Compare To Similac Pro- Sensitive Enfamil Gentlease Similac Pro-Total Comfort Similac Soy Isomil and Enfamil ProSobee Nutramigen & Similac Alimentum Description complete nutrition for babies with fussiness & gas when sensitive to lactose complete nutrition with easy to digest proteins for fussiness, gas & crying complete nutrition with easy to digest proteins for delicate tummies complete nutrition in soy-based based formula complete nutrition that helps relieve the symptoms of colic from cow's milk allergy Milk-Based ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ 99% Reduced Lactose (compared to our standard milk formula) ✓ Lactose Free ✓ ✓ Partially Broken Down Proteins ✓ ✓ Fully Broken Down Proteins ✓ Multi HMO Prebiotics for Immune Support & Digestive Health ✓ ✓ Probiotic for Digestive Health Support ✓ No Artificial Growth Hormones ✓ ✓ ✓ NA ✓

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nothing but great things to say about this product!
reviews.reviewText: My son drunks hypoallergenic formula and hasn’t complained when we switched to amazon brand. They deliver right away when you order it and I love that if we are in a pinch on time, making it super convenient! Now that we’ve switched to this brand, we are sticking with it! No complaints over here. Thank you Amazon!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Same as the other store-brand hypoallergenics
reviews.reviewText: This is the same as the other store-brand hypoallergenic formulas like at Target, Kroger, etc. I’m finding that those places have been low or out lately, so this has been a very convenient alternative source for what is the same formula.I’ve found that the store-brand does not mix quite as well as Nutramigen, but as long as I shake well, any clumps left at the beginning are gone by the time my daughter finishes her bottle. Huge money saver! Highly recommend this formula!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great as a supplement to Nutramagen
reviews.reviewText: My daughter is prescribed Nutramagen, but with what is going on with baby formula I purchased this formula in the mean time. I'm typically skeptical over reviews...especially over anything that has to do with baby products, but this really is a good product. My daughter never has any stomach issues and it is as close to Nutramagen as you can get.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Clumps terribly, not a good replacement for Nutramigen, zero customer service
reviews.reviewText: We tried to use this as a replacement for Nutramigen given the shortage, but we will not be using again. It clumps terribly, making it hard to pass through the bottle nipple, and it has an awful and unattractive yellow color to it. I tried to return or at least ask for a refund form Amazon (including an unopened canister) and was stonewalled by customer service. Also, the website they offer up for Mama Bear Amazon products is an Australian company that has nothing to do with Amazon's private label baby products. We will not be using any Mama Bear products from Amazon again. I would recommend another hypoallergenic formula if you're looking for a replacement for Nutramigen, like Similac Alimentum.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing value and great on my babies tummy
reviews.reviewText: One of the best hypoallergenic formulas around!No spits ups.Regular poops.Easy poops.Baby loves it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Works well as a substitute for Nutramigen
reviews.reviewText: Baby did not seem to appreciate any difference between the Mama Bear brand and the Nutramigen. The only difference I noted was Mam Bear needed a few additional shakes of the bottle to completely dissolve the formula. With the great difficulty in locating the Nutramigen , this Amazon product definitely provided much needed peace of mind.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Baby had an allergic reaction
reviews.reviewText: I was hoping I could rely on off brand formula during this shortage.. my baby is normally on Nutramigen. Unfortunately, she’s had a reaction to this formula. She’s covered in eczema just as she was before we knew it was a milk allergy. Not sure what exactly is in this since it says it’s for dairy allergies. Just a forewarning to other parents, this may cause a reaction.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2022
reviews.reviewText: Stuff is great, but now all of a sudden it’s 12oz instead of 19 and more expensive… Thanks ;(
